availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Walter Alves Norwood (Henderson County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, physician. North Carolina native. Son of William Norwood and Robina Hogg Norwood. Married Mary Lambert Norwood in Henderson, Kentucky on April 29, 1856. Father of Eliza Norwood and Robenier Norwood. Attended the University of North Carolina between 1823-1826. Partnership with Dr. Robert P. Letcher in Henderson, Kentucky c.1855. Physician in Henderson County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1860. Murdered allegedly by escaped slave, Jim Brown, on April 1, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 85.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, p. 146.

Kentucky Digital Newspaper Program, https://kentuckynewspapers.org/catalog/xt7rxw47qw60?q=Dr.+Norwood (accessed April 10, 2019).
Kemp B. Battle, “Sketches of the History of University of North Carolina,” in U.S., College Student Lists, 1763-1924 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Alves Norwood Apperson, Genealogy of the Norwood, Hogg, Lovick, Benners and Howell, Garrett, Harrison Lines (Portland, Oregon: Binfords & Mort, 1944), 18, 55, 82.
Edmund L. Starling, History of Henderson County, Kentucky (Henderson, Kentucky, 1887), 558-561.
